label: 常平倉
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: In good harvest years the central government bought grain at a fixed governmetnt price and stored it away in these storehouses (kura ), selling it in bad harvest years at the same fixed government price. Also called Jōheishi (Price-Stabilizing Offices ).
